biography.value: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

description.value: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

The creature attacks with its bite.

Melee Attack - 1 Creature (5 ft.)

  • Attack Bonus: +6
  • Damage: [[/damage 2d6 + 3 piercing]] damage, UNFINISHED

The Wolf attacks with its Bite. If the target is a creature, it must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
When the frenzy ends, the animal takes damage equal to its hit point maximum as its skeleton resets. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

The dire animal's skeleton suddenly grows spikes and other protrusions, which shoot out of the animal's flesh. The dire animal enters a frenzy. While in a frenzy, the dire animal gains temporary hit points equal to its hit point maximum, and can use its multiattack as a bonus action.

The frenzy lasts 1 minute. When the frenzy ends, the animal takes damage equal to its hit point maximum as its skeleton resets. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
An Elite creature counts as two monsters of a given level. It has +2 to all saves, as well as twice as many hit points and twice as much damage as a typical monster of its level.
You have advantage on perception checks, except where you cannot use hearing or smell. Note that when you have advantage, your passive perception increases by 5.
